skill.name: writing-plans
skill.description: Use when design is complete and you need detailed implementation tasks for engineers with zero codebase context - creates comprehensive implementation plans with exact file paths, complete code examples, and verification steps assuming engineer has minimal domain knowledge
skill.summary: Use when design is complete and you need detailed implementation tasks for engineers with zero codeb...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution capabilities. Only contains markdown documentation for creating implementation plans. No filesystem access, network calls, or external command execution.

content.value_statement: Implementation plans are often incomplete or assume too much context. This skill generates comprehensive, bite-sized tasks with exact file paths, code examples, and verification steps. Engineers can start coding immediately without guessing.
actual_capabilities: Generates comprehensive implementation plans from design documents
Creates bite-sized tasks with 2-5 minute completion estimates
Provides exact file paths and code examples for each step
Includes verification commands with expected outputs
Documents test cases with minimal passing implementations
limitations: Requires existing design or feature specification to work from
Does not execute code or run tests directly
Does not modify the codebase itself
Assumes engineer will follow the plan manually or via executing-plans skill

use_cases.title: Hand off designs to developers
use_cases.description: Transform high-level architecture into actionable task lists that junior developers can execute without asking clarifying questions.

use_cases.title: Break down complex features
use_cases.description: Divide large features into TDD-friendly tasks with test-first approach and commit-ready code snippets.

use_cases.title: Document contribution guides
use_cases.description: Create contributor-friendly implementation plans that work across different skill levels and knowledge domains.

prompt_templates.title: New feature plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-plans skill to create an implementation plan for adding user authentication with OAuth2 support.

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-plans skill to create an implementation plan for fixing the memory leak in the data processing module.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-plans skill to create an implementation plan for refactoring the legacy payment processing code to use the new event system.

prompt_templates.title: Integration plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use writing-plans skill to create an implementation plan for integrating the Stripe payment API across all checkout flows.

best_practices: Pair with subagent-driven-development skill for hands-free execution in the current session
Save plans to a dedicated worktree created by the brainstorming skill
Include verification commands with expected outputs to catch regressions early
anti_patterns: Using writing-plans without first clarifying the feature scope and requirements
Skipping the plan and jumping directly into coding complex features
Treating the plan as final rather than a living document to update as work progresses

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Optimized for Claude Code's subagent workflow.

faq.question: How detailed are the tasks?
faq.answer: Each task is 2-5 minutes of work with exact code snippets, file paths, and test commands.

faq.question: Can I execute the plan automatically?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the executing-plans skill or subagent-driven-development skill for automated execution.

faq.question: Does this modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. The skill only creates markdown documentation. Execution skills handle actual code changes.

faq.question: Where are plans saved?
faq.answer: Plans save to docs/plans/YYYY-MM-DD-feature-name.md in your repository.

faq.question: How is this different from brainstorming?
faq.answer: Brainstorming explores ideas and designs. Writing-plans converts completed designs into actionable implementation steps.
